How does the worker user interface work?

When an active worker is in a location where it can do something - say construct a road, build an improvement, or clear land - the Worker Action Panel is visible. This panel displays all actions available to the worker at that location. Click on an action to order the worker to start building. Worker actions take time; hover the cursor over the action to see how long it will take the worker to complete that action.
The Worker Action Panel
What do workers and improvements do?
How do roads work?

Workers can construct roads once their civilization has acquired the wheel technology. Roads can be constructed in friendly, neutral or enemy territory. They can be built in any terrain and across any features, except for mountains, Natural Wonders and ice (and of course they can't be built in water tiles). Roads can be constructed in tiles with resources and/or improvements. See the section on roads for more details.
Building Roads
Technology Required: Trapping[NEWLINE]Construction Time: 7 Turns[NEWLINE]Resources Accessed: Ivory, Fur, Deer
Camp
How does clearing land work?

Once their civilization has learned the mining technology, workers can remove forests from tiles. Once they have learned bronze working, they can remove jungle. And once they have learned masonry, workers can drain marshes. Once these features are removed, they are gone forever.
Clearing Land
What happens when workers are attacked?

Workers are non-military units. They are captured when an enemy unit enters their tile, and they can be damaged by ranged attacks as well (they heal like other units, but they do not gain experience or receive promotions). Workers cannot attack or damage any other unit. It's a really good idea to stack a military unit with a worker if it's in dangerous territory.
Workers in Combat
How long does it take to construct a road?
It takes a worker 3 turns to construct a road in any tile.
Time to Construct a Road
How do you construct a worker?
Workers are built in cities, just like other units.
Creating Workers
How long does it take to build an improvement?

Each improvement type takes a certain amount of time. It will take longer to construct improvements in marathon games, and shorter in games started in later eras.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Terrain Modifiers: Improvements constructed in tundra and deserts will take 25% longer than the standard time to construct, while improvements constructed in snow will take 50% longer.
Duration to Construct
How does the farm improvement work?

The farm is the earliest and most commonly-constructed improvement. All civilizations begin play knowing how to farm. Farm improvements can be constructed in most tiles, and atop a number of resources:[NEWLINE]Technology Required: Agriculture (acquired at start of game)[NEWLINE]May Be Constructed: Farm improvements cannot be built on ice, mountains or Natural Wonders. They can only be built on hills and desert tiles if the tile is next to a source of fresh water such as rivers, lakes, or another farm improvement. Farms increase the tile's output by 1 food.[NEWLINE]Duration of Construction: 5 Turns[NEWLINE]Forest: Farms may be constructed in forested tiles once you learn the mining tech. The forest is removed when the farm is built. Total Construction Time: 9 Turns[NEWLINE]Jungle: Farms may be constructed in jungle tiles once you learn the bronze working tech. The jungle is removed when the farm is built. Total Construction Time: 12 Turns[NEWLINE]Marsh: Farms may be constructed in marsh tiles when you learn the masonry tech. The marsh is removed when the farm is constructed. Total Construction Time: 11 Turns[NEWLINE]Resources Accessed: Farms can access the wheat resource, increasing the tile's output by 1 food and 1 gold.
Farm Improvements
Technology Required: Sailing[NEWLINE]Construction Time: Immediately[NEWLINE]Resources Accessed: Fish, Whales, Pearls
Fishing Boat
What happens when a water improvement is pillaged?
Water improvements are totally destroyed when pillaged. They cannot be repaired; they must be rebuilt entirely (which consumes another work boat). Guard your water improvements!
Fishing Boats and Oil Platforms
Great people can construct improvements? Really?
Great People can construct special improvements. See their rules for details.
Great People Improvements

Workers represent the men and women who build your empire. They clear the jungles and build the farms which feed your cities. They dig the mines that provide you with precious gold and mighty iron. They lay the roads which connect your cities. Although they are not military units, workers are important.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Improvements increase the production, gold, and/or food output of tiles. They also provide access to the special bonuses provided by certain resources. If you do not improve your land, your civilization will almost certainly be overwhelmed by others which have.
Workers and Improvements
When can you build improvements?
Once a civilization has learned the appropriate technology, its workers can construct improvements.
Constructing Improvements
What happens if a worker moves before an improvement is complete?

If you leave a project in the middle and then resume the same project later on, the time already spent will be subtracted from the amount of time it takes to complete the project.[NEWLINE]If you change projects, however, all progress from the previous project will be lost.
Leaving and Resuming Improvements
Lumbermills increase a forested tile's output by 1 production, without destroying the forest.[NEWLINE]Technology Required: Machinery Construction Time: 7 Turns[NEWLINE]May Be Constructed On: Forests
Lumber Mill
How does the mine improvement work?

The mine improvement is learned when your civilization acquires the mining tech. It can be used to increase the production output of many tiles, and it also unlocks a variety of resources. The mine is as important as farming.[NEWLINE]Technology Required: Mining[NEWLINE]May be Constructed: Only on Hill tiles. Mines increase a tile's output by 1 production.[NEWLINE]Duration of Construction: 5 Turns[NEWLINE]Forest: Mines may be constructed in forested tiles. The forest is removed when the mine is built. Total Construction Time: 9 Turns.[NEWLINE]Jungle: Mines may be constructed in jungle tiles once you learn the bronze working tech. The jungle is removed when the mine is built. Total Construction Time: 12 Turns[NEWLINE]Marsh: Mines may be constructed in marsh tiles when you learn the masonry tech. The marsh is removed when the mine is constructed. Total Construction Time: 11 Turns[NEWLINE]Resources Accessed: Mines unlock the iron, coal, aluminum, uranium, gems, gold and silver resources. See the individual resources' entries for details.
Mine Improvements

What does it mean to pillage an improvement or road?

Enemy units can "pillage" roads and improvements, rendering them temporarily useless - no resource, no movement bonus, and so forth. It is as if the worker never built the road or made the improvement.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]A unit may even pillage its own civilization's improvement (typically to deny it to another civilization who is about to capture the first civilization's city).[NEWLINE]A unit that pillages an improvement may gain a gold bonus but will use one movement point.
Pillaging Roads and Improvements

How can a pillaged improvement or road be repaired?
A worker may repair a pillaged road or improvement. It takes a worker 3 turns to repair any road or improvement.
Repairing Roads and Improvements
How does the fort improvement work?

The fort improvement is a special improvement that is constructed by workers and provides protection to military units in friendly territory. The fort may be constructed in a friendly or neutral tile. Constructing a fort atop an existing improvement will destroy the previous improvement.[NEWLINE]Defensive Bonus of the Fort: 50%
The Special Fort Improvement
How can one tell how much time is left to build an improvement?
Hover your cursor over a worker to see how much time is remaining on the current construction job.
How Much Time is Left?
How long does it take to clear out a feature?
Remove Forest: 3 Turns[NEWLINE]Remove Jungle: 6 Turns[NEWLINE]Drain Marsh: 5 Turns
Time to Clear Land
How do trade routes work?

If there is a road between your capital and another of your cities, those cities have a "trade route." Trade routes give your civilization gold bonuses each turn, the amount depending upon the size of the cities involved. (Harbors can also create trade routes between coastal cities.) See the section on Trade Routes for details.
Roads and Trade Routes

The trading post increases output of a tile by 1 gold. It doesn't access a resource.[NEWLINE]Technology Required: Trapping[NEWLINE]Construction Time: 5 Turns[NEWLINE]May Be Constructed On: Any land tile but ice
Trading Post
Where can improvements be constructed?

Improvements can be built only in appropriate locations. (Farms may not be built on ice, for example, and mines can't be built atop cattle resources.) The Worker Action Panel will only display improvements that your civilization has the technology for and that are appropriate for the tile the active worker occupies. Generally, farms and mines can be constructed in any tile that doesn't contain a resource. If the tile does contain a resource, only the appropriate improvement can be constructed.
Where to Construct Improvements
What do work boats do?

Work Boats are special worker units built in coastal cities. They can create fishing boats and offshore platform improvements in water. Unlike land workers, Work Boats are consumed when they create an improvement.
Work Boats
